name: Text
format:
WARNING:
Since the flow has started, no value has been received from mqtt topic TOP111 (Z1_Sensor_Settings) for 10 minutes.
Without this value, it is not possible for for the flow to operate correctly. As a result, no HEAT setpoint values will be sent to the heatpump.

Firmware:
The reason for not receiving TOP111 values could be that the HeishaMon firmware is lower than version 3.1.
Considder checking and updating your heishamon firmware. Here is a collection of the latest firmware versions:
https://github.com/Egyras/HeishaMon/tree/master/binaries

Set TOP111 manually:
In the dropdown you can manually set the required value for TOP111.
In the Panasonic wallmounted controller, under [System settings] > [Zone & Control], you have configured the control method. The options are:
- Water Temperature
- Thermostat (External)
- Thermostat (Internal)
- Room Sensor)

The Zone 1 configuration in the wallmounted controller, needs to be selected in the above dropdown.


Note:

- If you have set this value manually and after some time the TOP111 value IS received from HeishaMon, it will just correct and overwrite the manually set value.
- If you do not have firmware 3.1 (or higher) you always need to keep the manually set value in sync with the value set in the wallmounted controller.
This should not a major issue, because this setting is most often: "Set and forget".
- Once you have set this value manually, you should be able to see it under [System] > [Hardware] on the bottom.
- Setting this value through the dashboard will NOT send any information to HeishaMon / Panasonic heatpump. It is used only within NodeRed.

name: Function RTC automation
INFO INSIDE: Panasonic compressor rules
info:
**Compressor on:**
Main inlet 4 degrees lower than setpoint

Formula:    [TOP5] <= [TOP27] - 4;
            
                [TOP5]  Main inlet
                [TOP27] Setpoint (in direct mode)




**Compressor off:**
Main outlet temperature is 2 degrees higher than setpoint, for 3 minutes

Formula:    [TOP6] + 2 >= [TOP27]

                [TOP6]  Main outlet
                [TOP27] Setpoint (in direct mode)

name: function 29
function 64
Line - Instructions text
format:
Solar


What can this function do for you?

The aim of this function is to increase efficiency (and save cost) by utilize your own produced solar energy as much as possible. When there is solar energy in abundance, you can use that energy to heat up your DHW. To determine if there is enough solar energy, you need a power measurement. This can be a P1 power meter or you can use the output from your inverter.

How to setup?

First go to the Solar page and click P1 SETUP, there you have to set the Correction factor. This can either be 1 or 1000, depending if your source feeds watts or Kilowatts. Set this for Consumption and Production. You will see the corrected result straight away, but of course, it needs to be sunny for the production values to show, as these are realtime values. Also be aware that in general, power consumption is always a positive value, and power production is a negative value.

Secondly, you need to set the DHW setpoints.

DHW temperature setpoint These are the target temperatures for the water in DHW tank. DHW temperature setpoint - high will be used when power measurement dropped below the threshold. DHW temperature setpoint - low will be used after the DHW tank has reached its target temperature high.

Power detection method There are three options available.

Option 1: Power Live (kW)
 Live energy production in watt. See (1) in image below.

Option 2: Today's production (kWh) Todays energy production, expressed in kWh. Energy consumption will NOT be added to this value, it will only decrease. See (2) in image below.

Option 3: Today's result (kWh) Todays result, which is the sum of production and consumption. See (3) in image below.

Threshold This is the threshold for the power readming. When the measured value drops below threshold, the DHW temperature setpoint - high will be set as the new target value.

Allow switch on heat pump When the pump is off, and the threshold is reached, enabling this will turn on the heat pump. If this toggle is disabled, the pump will remain off.

Fallback to default DHW (SP) below 0 W? Applies only when threshold "Power live (kW)" option 1 is used. By default, once DHW temperature setpoint - high is being used, it will NOT switch back to DHW SP low until the temperature is reached. If you do want to fall back to DHW SP low when power production drops below zero watt, enable Fallback to DHW (SP) below 0 W?

Cooldown period after DHW run When the high DHW target temperature has been reached, the heatpump will stay in DHW mode for a set amount of time. This could help to prevent too hot water going through the HEAT system.

Notes:


- Power option 1 can cause power cycling

name: Line - Instructions text
format:
WAR - Weather Adaptable Regulation


What can this function do for you?

The aim of this function is to dynamically change the water temperature used for heating, compensating for the outside weather. If it is very cold outside, you require more heat compared to when it is warmer outside to end up with a comfortable house. This function will thuss compensate the increasing heat loss the colder it get outside.
This will allow the heat pump to run at a lower, more efficient rate saving you energy. This will reduce cycling of the compressor to increase its lifetime.

How to setup?


Temperature profile Here you can program three points, where you give the outside temperature and the corresponding target water temperatures.
The first (top) point is the highest outside temperature, by default this one is set to 15 °C. This corresponds to the maximum outside temperature the Panasonic accepts. The last (bottom) point should be the lowest outside temperature you will realistically experience in you situation.
With the center point you can adjust the curve more to your liking. This will give you the ability to give you a bit more heat when freezing for example. This will give you the WAR temperature profile graph. Default values: xxx

Result The actual outside temperature is used to find the corresponding water temperature according to your given settings. The result will be rounded to whole degrees celcius and shown at Calculated temp..

Advanced If you want to use the WAR functionality of the Panasonic itself instead of this flow, you can export the Temperature profile to your HeishaMon / Panasonic.

Notes:

- The Panasonic has its own outside thermometer, this is typically located in the little black rubber tube on the back of the device. It’s quite inaccurate, especially if the sun is allowed to reach it, it is strongly recommended to use a proper outside sensor
- Outside temperature range: -20°C - 15°C
- Water temperature range: 20°C - 60°C
- The Panasonic internally works with 2 points, instead of the 3 in this flow
- If you do not require three points, use 2 identical Water temperatures but unique Outside temperatures

name: Line - Instructions text
format:
RTC - Room Temperature Correction


What can this function do for you?

This function corrects the water temperature (HEAT) based on the actual room temperature. This function is for example useful when direct sunlight warms up the room. The setpoint is automatically lowered.

The source for the correction is the temperature difference between [Room actual] and [Room setpoint].

The temperature difference is devided in ranges. You can set them under the [Difference] column. When the room is too warm, the water temperature is corrected with the negative correction value.
When the room is too cold, the water temperature is corrected with the positive correction value.
Within a T diff range, the correction stays constant

When this function is properly configured, it will result in a more stable (comfortable) room temperature. On the other hand, when not correctly configured it can result in more variations in the room temperature. This last scenario can causing additional wear and increased energy costs. So please take your time to set it up right for your situation.

Configuration

First enter a desired temperature at [Room setpoint].
Secondly you need to enter at which point the water temperature will be changed by 1, 2 or 3 degrees celcius. This will take a bit of experimenting. For example if you use floor heating smaller deltas (0.1) work better because by its nature it is slow to respond. When using radiators you can increase the deltas (0.5). Try to make small changes at a time and observe the result for at least 1 or 2 days.
Lastly, enable the toggle [RTC] on the top left of the dashboard.

Default values:
+/-0,5 degree difference results in a correction of +/-1 degree.
+/-1,0 degree difference results in a correction of +/-2 degrees.
+/-1,5 degree difference results in a correction of +/-3 degrees.

Requirements:

The Panasonic has a themperature sensor in the wall mounted Remote Controller. But... It is inaccurate and really not suitable to use for this RTC function. Please use a custom indoor sensor with an accuracy of 0,1°C. For example a BMP280 or BME280. Be sure to place it somewhere out of direct sunlight or a cold draft.
The measurements need to be available in this Node Red flow.

-----------------------------------
Calculate linear correction By default, as a result of the temperature differece setpoint vs room temperature, the correction on the water temperature is a step-change. Between the last two
When enabled, the setpoints (water temperatures) will be incrementally calculated in steps of 1°C. This applies only between the +3 and +custom temperature ranges.

Automations: To make use of the automation, you need to set two temperatures (dT's).
[Trigger action above dT]: When the room temperature is above this line, the selected action(s) will be executed.
[Revert action below dT]: When the room temperature drops below this line, the reverse action(s) will be executed.
Both the above/below dT temperatures are relative to the setpoint.

Action: Change operating mode
If the room temperature is above dT, the current operating mode will have HEAT mode removed from it.
If the room temperature is below dT, the current operating mode will have HEAT mode added to it.

Action: Turn off/on power
If the room temperature is above dT, the heatpump will be turned off. (condition: Operating Mode must be Heat-only or Auto(Heat))
If the room temperature is below dT, the heatpump will be turned on again.

name: Line - Instructions text
format:
Scheduler instructions


What can the scheduler do for you?

You can program certain tasks to be started at the specified time and day.

What is the main difference between this scheduler and the native Panasonic one?

The Panasonic scheduler always swtiches on the heat pump when a task is due. This scheduler offers you control over this behavior. The native Panasonic scheduler can be operational simultaneously with this scheduler. This can be convenient for some very specific tasks, but it is strongly recommended to only use one scheduler to avoid conflicting tasks and unexpected behavior. Both schedulers do not communicate.

Enable This simply enables or disables the task.

Name Give your personal short name or description to the task.

Action Select the action you want to perform.
Force DHW
This action will do several things:
1 - Add DHW to the current operating mode if missing
2 - Turn on [Force DHW mode]
3 - Execute the DHW run to the target temperature
4 - Turn off [Force DHW mode]
5 - Remove DHW from Operating mode again if it was missing at step 1

Attention: The Force DHW run will not start if the current DHW temperature is above the set temperature in [Force DHW - Allow only below] in the 'related settings' section. If you do not want this, set this temperature very high (eg. 100 degree C). The Panasonic internal rules (minimum dT) will always be followed.

The scheduled Force DHW action is fundamentally different compared to the switch Force DHW under settings or on the controller. They requires certain conditions.

- Force Sterilization This action will do several things:
1 - Add DHW to the current operating mode if missing
2 - Turn on [Force DHW mode] + Turn on [Force Sterilization]
3 - Execute the Sterilization run to the target temperature
4 - Turn off [Force Sterilization mode] + Turn off [Force DHW mode]
5 - Remove DHW from Operating mode again

- Quiet Mode This will set the quiet mode to the specified level.

- Operation Mode This will set the operation mode as specified.

- Nightreduction water temperature on/off This wil add a negative correction to the water temperature, which will result in a lower Final water temperature (but never lower then 20 °C).

- Nightreduction room temperature on/off When on this will reduce the RTC room setpoint to the setpoint-low value set on the right.
When off this will restore the RTC room setpoint to the setpoint-Normal value set on the right.
Defaults: ON = 18 °C , OFF = 21 °C , RANGE 0 °C - 30 °C

Power on By default a task will not run if the heat pump is powered off. If you want the heat pump to be powered on and execute the task, enable the power on toggle.

Heat water temperature limits Here you can program the absolut upper and lower limits you never want HEAT to go over/under. This can be used to prevent oscillating behaviour, make compressor runs longer and the HP more efficient.
Nightreduction Room setpoint
Here you can set the room setpoint LOW and NORMAL when using task Nightreduction room setpoint.

Condition Each line in the scheduler can be linked to one condition. When selecting a condition, the settings screen for that appears, with instructions.
Note that you can select multiple scheduled actions to one and the same condition. (flexible)

name: Line - Instructions text pt1
format:
SoftStart


What can the SoftStart function do for you?

Default behaviour of the heatpump when the compressor starts for a HEAT run, is that the frequency (Hz) will go to medium / high level. The frequency stays high until the returning water temperature (See Temp. inlet (PV) at the Home screen) approaches the setpoint. Only then the compressor ramps down.

The primary goal of this function is to quickly lower the compressor frequency after starting a HEAT run. The heatpump will more quickly be in a stable / low power operating windows. As a result of that the length of the run might increase, it consumes less energy and generating less noise. A downside of this could be that heating is slower.

A secondairy goal of this function is to increase compressor runtime by slowly increasing the water setpoint. The setpoint will contineously be moved just outside the window where it will stop a heating run. By allowing the setpont to slide up along with the returning water (Tinlet), the run length will not be terminated. A possible downside of this could be the room temperature getting too high.

name: Line - Instructions text pt2
format:
How it works

In the graph above, shown is the compressor frequency (Hz) vs time (minutes).

Primary goal - Reduce frequency ASAP

(1) Runtime Set the duration this function to be active from the start. After this time, the correction on the water setpoint will be set to 0 (zero ) again. Default: 15 minutes
(2) Max. setpoint increase This will set the maximum setpoint increase for the water temperature. This is relative to the normally calculated water temperature. The higher increase allowed, the longer the compressor will run. But of course, the higher the overshoot in room temperature could be. Default: 1 °C

Additional settings.

(3) QuietMode (Optional) QuietMode 1, 2 and 3 have an effect on the maximum allowed compressor frequency and fan speed. QuietMode 3 will limit compressor and fan speed the most.
Enable / disable the use of QuietMode by the softstart function.
Default: Disabled
Set the duration for it to be active from the start of a HEAT run.

Reset after defrost When enabled, the softstart function will be reset during a defrost. This will result in 'catching' the high compressor frequencies each time. When disabled, the counter will continue after a defrost. As a result of this, the softstart function can reach the 'end'-pont sooner.
Default: Disabled

Secondary goal - Prevent short HEAT runs

(1) Runtime Up to the user. Typically in the range of 1 - 24 hour(s).

(2) Max. setpoint increase Up to the user. Typically in the range of 2°C - 3°C degrees.


Note: When softstart function is enabled, it does not guarantee the compressor won't turn off within this time period. Normal internal logic of the Panasonic still applies, so when the water is warm enough the compressor stops.

Note 2: There are multiple types of heatpumps. Split units, monoblock, T-CAP. Not all types respond in the same way during a heat run. Example, the T-CAP can be slow to reduce the compressor frequency after start.

name: Line - Instructions text
format:
COOL function


Requirements

If you want to use the function, you require a good temperature and humidity sensor in the target area.
With this information the dew point is calculated. The requested cool setpoint temperature will be automatically be corrected to be above the dew point.

What is a dew point?

Air in a room contains a certain amount of water / humidity. This water is gaseous / vapour. When the air temperature lowers, the amount of humidity that is able to 'fit' in gaseous form, lowers as well. At a certain temperature it is at its maximum (100% humidity). Below this temperature, water vapour starts to condensate onto cold objects.
The temperature where water in the air starts to condensate, is called the dew-point.

Why is calculating a dew point important?

When the temperature of the cooling water is below the dew point, water will condensate on the radiators or your floor heating system. Water ends up on the floor. Combine this with a good ventilation system (read: endless supply of fresh air ... and gaseous water) this could become a big wet problem if you have a wooden floor.

I do not have a humidity sensor. Can I still cool?

Yes. Of course.
But the responsibility of not setting a too low target temperature is your own.

Settings

Setpoint requested Set the desired setpoint temperature of the cooling water.

Safety margin: This value is added to the calculated dew point temperature. The minimum and default is 1.5 °C.

Lower limit (man): You can manually set a fixed lower limit of the cooling set point.

Lower limit (calc): This is the calculated lower limit of the setpoint.
[Value] = [dew point temperature] + [Safety margin]
This value is not rounded.

final setpoint: The final setpoint value is the [Lower limit (calc)] value but always rounded up. So a calculated value of 15.01 will result in a [Setpoint final] temperature of 16°C.

Conditions: There are conditions for the function to allow sending a new final setpoint to the heat pump.
When the heatpump is turned OFF, the new setpoint wil NOT be sent.
When current operating mode is (0) Heat Only, (2) Auto(Heat), (3) DHW Only or (4) Heat+DHW, a new setpoint will NOT be sent
In these cases, the calculated setpoint shown in the graph and settings will be incorrect or not updated.


For reference:
T dew point = 243.12 * A / (17.62 - A)
A = Math.log( RH / 100) / Math.log(2.718282) + 17.62 * Temperature / (243.12 + Temperature)

name: Condition help
format:
Setting a condition is optional.
For every scheduled action you can define a blocking condition. This means that when the scheduled action is triggered the condition is evaluated.
When the condition is TRUE, the action will be blocked.

The conditions are:

DHW temperature is above If the last measured DHW temperature is above the given value, the action will be blocked.

time since last sterelization is less than If the DHW temperature is 60°C or higher, it takes minutes to sterelize (kill legionella) the tank. The date/time the water is 60+°C is stored. If the elapsed time since then is less than the given value, the action will be blocked. (Note: make sure the measured temperature is good and representative in the tank)

time since DHW temp was on target temperature is less than The date/time the water is at the target temperature is stored. If the elapsed time since then is less than the given value, the action will be blocked.

time since previous trigger of this scheduled action is less than The date/time of each scheduled action is stored. If the elapsed time since then is less than the given value, the action will be blocked.

format:
</br>
<u>Release notes</u></br>

Changes compared to v23.00 stable</br>
- Breaking change: New flow-tab "WP Input". All external sensors and triggers are now managed from this tab.</br>
- Breaking change: External sensors used with functions are now handled partly though the dashboard. (DASHBOARD > SYSTEM >
SENSORS)</br>
- A lot of stability issues and bugs have been resolved. Thanks to all issue reporters and the Dutch www.tweakers.net
users</br>
- First boot of new installations has been improved a lot.</br>
- The flow works correct using "Compensation Curve" or "Direct" mode.</br>
- The flow works correct using zone control "Water Temperature", "Thermostat (External)", "Thermostat (Internal)" or "Room
sensor".</br>
- Resource improvement; CPU usage has been decreased by ~30%.</br>
</br>
As always, enjoy your heat pump!</br>
</br>
/Ed ter bak

For the full changelog please visit the github page and unfold the button "changelog".

name: naming convention
info:
MQTT	
	.active									MQTT block enabled/disabled 1,0
	.allow_rtc_onoff			
	.allow_scheduler			
	.allow_solar				
	.block_mode								BLOCK ALL (1) , CUSTOM (2), UNRESTRICTED (3)
	.counter				    			Total MQTT messages counter
	.messages_today			    			No. MQTT messages today
	.messages_yesterday		    			No. MQTT messages yesterday
	.message_limit			    			Maximum allowed messages in 24h allow before block will activate


NightReductionWaterTempOn 		    		scheduler task to activate night reduction water temp
NightReductionWaterTempOff		    		scheduler task to deactivate night reduction water temp

NightReductionWaterTemp
	.current_value							renamed from NightReduction_current_value
	.correction								renamed from NightReduction_correction
	.state									renamed from nightreduction_on_off

NightReductionRoomSetpoint
	.state 									Night reduction room setpoint status (1,0)
	.LOW									renamed from RoomSetpointLOW
	.NORMAL									renamed from RoomSetpointNORMAL

F_ReducePumpSpeed
	.state									Reduce pump speed active 1,0
	.PumpMaxFlowSetting						
	.NormalSpeed							Value to restore to when disabled
	.LowSpeed								Value used as low pump speed when active

F_RTC
	.state									RTC main function on/off (1,0) (old name: Correction_1_RTC_on_off)
	.incremental_setpoints_state			incremental_setpoints status of switch. (Renamed from Booster), value 1,0
	.correction_value (Memory Only)			RTC correction (renamed from F_RTC_correction)
	.F1_power_state							function turn on/off heatpump (1,0)
	.F2_OM_state							function change OM heatpump
	.on_off_active							0= waiting to turn heat on. 1= waiting to turn heat off
	.on_off_status							value: 0,1,2

Defrost
	.Counter								Renamed from Defrost_Counter
	.Counter_Today							Renamed from Defrost_Counter_Today
	.Counter_Yesterday						Renamed from Defrost_Counter_Yesterday
